name: accountably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If someone behaves accountably, they are responsible for what they do and are able to give a satisfactory reason for it: It is a requirement of public servants that they act accountably. The workforce has been complaining for some time that management have not been working accountably.
More examplesFewer examplesThese special political advisers wield their power invisibly and never accountably.A government cannot govern accountably if there is no framework of checks and balances in place.They have not been running the business as accountably as they should.
